I'm adding that to the CSS file, but it doesn't change anything. I've also tried adding it to the Wrapping HTML   using <style>, but that didn't do the trick either. Is there somewhere else I should be adding this code?

Hi-- I am working on developing a site for a client. We're using the ProX theme as a jumping-off point and trying to use the recent blog posts module. When I go to select a blog for it to display, it won't update and will only show the default. Could someone help?
I am not familiar of the exact workings of the module but is there a button to apply? Have you then refreshed after that?
Sometimes you have to refresh to pull in the new blog posts. If this isn't the case, I suggest contact the theme creator support. <mailto:support@smarthubl.com|support@smarthubl.com>

<@U02NVBTKCKF> Ahhh well a few things — looks like your css declaration for the background image is inlined css — which is loading after what youve just added. So at the same level of specificity - the new declaration isnt taking effect. To fix that you can just make the new declaration more specific. So instead of `#blog-footer`   You could say `body #blog-footer {...}` That should work.

You could also add an important flag to the style, but that would make it more difficult to override later on… so I wouldn’t recommend it.

Lastly you have `background: 0`  instead of `background: none;`

``` @media(max-width:768px){
     body #blog-footer {
      background: none;
    }
}```
I've tried that and reached out to support
I just wasn't sure if someone would have a faster answer :slightly_smiling_face:
<@UQWGKUEN7> Got it to work! Thank you SO much!!
